definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
see 深入淺出|深入浅出[shen1 ru4 qian3 chu1]

sentences.english: The night side of the Moon, also, under certain circumstance, shows some luminescence phenomena.
sentences.chinese: 月面的夜區在某些情況下也會顯出某種發光現象。

sentences.english: The photograph showed a distinct image.
sentences.chinese: 照片顯出了明晰的影像。

sentences.english: Nick giggled;the first exprression of mirth he had exhibited.
sentences.chinese: 尼克喫喫地笑了，他第一次顯出開心的模樣。

sentences.english: let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 他就當在智慧的溫柔上，顯出他的善行來。

sentences.english: It hangs on dark brown waxed cotton cord and speaks volumes of superb taste and elegance.
sentences.chinese: 配以深咖啡色棉臘繩顯出文雅品位。

sentences.english: The stallion had never shown any sign of tiring.
sentences.chinese: 斯泰林從來沒有顯出一點累的跡象。

sentences.english: That creature had gone a little way when she began to limp and show every sign of being footsore.
sentences.chinese: 那個傢伙走不多遠，就一瘸一拐地顯出腳痛的樣子。

sentences.english: And I will shew wonders in the heavens and in the earth, blood, and fire, and pillars of smoke.
sentences.chinese: 在天上地下，我要顯出奇事，有血有火，有煙柱。

sentences.english: The Bishop gazed at her with an air of amazement.
sentences.chinese: 主教顯出一副驚奇的神氣瞧着她。

sentences.english: He gave every indication of being a fool.
sentences.chinese: 他處處顯出蠢人的跡象。

sentences.english: The curtains opened to reveal a darkened stage.
sentences.chinese: 帷幕拉開，顯出暗沉沉的舞臺。

sentences.english: There are no ugly women; there are only women who not know how to look pretty。
sentences.chinese: 沒有醜女人，只有不懂得如何使自己顯出美麗的女人。

sentences.english: The head of an enormous dog was outlined in the darkness at the entrance of the hut.
sentences.chinese: 黑暗中瞧見在那茅棚的洞口顯出一隻大狗頭。

sentences.english: Bob appears to be both vindictive and extortionate.
sentences.chinese: 他顯出一副報復和敲詐的樣子。

sentences.english: His forearms, where the sleeves were rolled back, showed bulging muscles .
sentences.chinese: 他雙袖上卷，前臂顯出隆起的肌肉。

sentences.english: They become braver and calmer, more fluid and playful.
sentences.chinese: 他們勇敢而沉着，更顯出曲線優美和頑皮。

definition: to present clearly/to give prominence to/to magnify/clear and obvious
to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
conspicuous/to make sth stand out/make sth prominent
it can clearly be seen (that this is the case)/it is (thus) clear/clear/visible
to appear/to emerge/to present (a certain appearance)/to demonstrate
line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
to conceal/to hide behind/to cover up
